intro: Baliospermum effusum, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in terminal inflorescences, resembling dandelion blooms. Baliospermum effusum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including roadsides and fields.
